558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:27): rocking777: that's not a form.  This is not standard... in almost any way.  You'll have to ask.. whomever wrote the scripts you're using.
6de03db66db8eefb7f57434e0d80d986 (10:27): no flannel.

558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:27): No, you don't.  Theres no <form> tag on this page at all.
6de03db66db8eefb7f57434e0d80d986 (10:28): <formtemplate> is equal to <form>
6de03db66db8eefb7f57434e0d80d986 (10:28): tag in html
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:28): there is NO form tag on this page
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:29): there's text, the Lorem Ipsum stuff
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:29): but, No forms, and not textareas, which you'd need inside the form if you wanted to edit them anyway

558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:30): on top of that, doctypes are case sensitive, xmp has been deprecated since... html3 (unfortunately), and I imagine the paths on the scripts are wrong anyway, double of the domain.
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:30): can someone help me with css+html rows/columns... http://bashusr.ath.cx:8080/photo_management.php.htm

558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:33): bashusr: it's fieldset not formset, and you'll have to do something with clearing, if you want straight rows like that
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:35): Flannel: i am doing clearing...
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:36): how can i do clear?
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:40): clear would make all of them go in a straight line down..

558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:40): well, the problem with clearing is you'd have to set a width.  You might try display: inline-block instead of floating, or table-cell... I believe that's your other option
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:42): Flannel: hmm.. doesn't seem to promising...
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:42): http://www.quirksmode.org/css/display.html
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:42): Of course the table display properties have rather poor support, as does inline-block.
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:42): Zeros: inline-block is doable though
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:42): that's what I'd go with bashusr
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:44): I'd say your milage may vary. Try it and if it works more power to you. :)
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:44): i am trying..
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:44): tell you how it works in a second
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:44): inline-block in IE only works on elements that default to inline last I checked
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:44): so it won't work on a div
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:44): it does have the nice side effect of causing Layout though :P
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:44): inline block you need to do display: -moz-inline-box; display: inline-block; then display: [opposite thing] for just IE
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:45): can i use a <span> the same way i would use a div?
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:45): bashusr: except for the elements you can put in a div vs a span are different, yes

2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:46): Maticode: what title?

167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (10:46): inside of a <a>

72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:47): or a dl, but that might get hairy for IE
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:47): i have to start the ul with a li won't i...
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:47): bashusr, you shouldn't ever use <br>, its semantically wrong except in very few cases such as poetry
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:47): bashusr, use a ul, and each of those items is a li
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:48): <li>Name:arch</li><li>Category: ....</li> etc.
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:48): Eh, I'd use more descriptive tags than that
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (10:48): sweet
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (10:48): dynamicdrive.com

2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:48): and arch on the right side?
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:48): or some sorta spacing so they don't look uneven?
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:49): Flannel, I suppose you could provide emphasis on the keys
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:50): Maticode, CSS3 allows you to do things like a:hover:after { content: attr(title); } and then position it somewhere.

72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:54): <li> is %flow and a header is %block

72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:55): Flannel, it is a list of data, adding another head for each single value doesn't seem to make sense.
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (10:55): personally, I'd make them each divs or something.  Then styling each one more structurally, so they make more sense sans styles
2353a428206baa5dab647a2bb42ee109 (10:55): but then the preview image stuck out like a sore thumb...

a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:18): hey i got a question. If I have a Stylesheet and the user posts a stylesheet through a textbox will the textbox stylesheet override the main stylesheet?
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (11:19): through a textbox?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:20): yeah im allowing the user to customize their profile that way
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (11:20): right, so. once they put it into the textbox, how does it get added to the page?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:20): no will it override the main stylesheet
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (11:20): it completely depends on how it's added to the page.
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:20): from a datbase
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:20): database
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (11:21): since, simply putting css in a textbox won't add it to the page at all.
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:21): it will be in the body
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (11:21): Shin-Ra: is it going to be linked? a <style> tag? how?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:21): i know
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:21): like <STYLE TYPE="text/css"> .quote { font-size: 8px; } </STYLE>
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (11:22): css cascade: http://w3.org/TR/CSS21/cascade.html#cascade
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (11:23): the info will be inserted into mssql then it will be Eval("AboutMe"); to the page
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (11:23): basically, yes.  Assuming it comes after your original styles in the source
